title: The Limitations of Reference Books in Libraries
story: You can't check out this one. It's a reference book. What does that mean? It means you can only read it in the library. But I need it for my essay. You can take pictures of the pages you need. I need almost all of them. You can keep coming back here. That's so inconvenient. It is, but they have to be kept here. I guess I can take pictures of the pages then. Sorry about the inconvenience. It is okay. It's not your fault.
summary: Reference books in libraries cannot be checked out and must be read within the library premises, posing challenges for those needing the information. Taking pictures of the pages is a potential solution to access the required content.
image: An image of a person using a smartphone to take pictures of pages in a reference book in a library.
